function.name: addAssertDecorator
function.help: Method used to dynamically add additional custom assertions at runtime.

parameter.name: decoratorName
parameter.help: The fully qualied name of the assertion component to add; e.g., org.mycompany.MyAssertionComponent

parameter.name: overrideBehaviors
parameter.help: Tells the framework whether or not to override any existing behaviors. For example, if your org.mycompany.MyAssertionComponent component has an assertTrue() and overridBehaviors is set to TRUE, the mxunit framework will use the new assertTrue() method and not it's own.

function.name: getStringValue
function.help: Attempts to return string representation of OBJ. Tests to see if object has toString or stringValue methods to be used for comparison and returns that string if present

parameter.name: obj
parameter.help: Any object

parameter.name: caseSensitive
parameter.help: If set to TRUE returns the original string unaltered. Default is to return the string in lowercase

function.name: init
function.help: Constructor

function.name: assertNotEquals
function.help: Core assertion that compares the values the EXPECTED and ACTUAL parameters. Throws mxunit.exception.AssertionFailedError.

parameter.name: expected
parameter.help: The expected object to compare.

parameter.name: actual
parameter.help: The actual object to compare.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Optional custom message to display if comparison fails.

function.name: getHashCode
function.help: Attempts to return hashCode representation of OBJ. Returns 0 for deep structs and component name or, if defined, the stringValue() representation of the component.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.help: Any object

function.name: setTestStyle
function.help: Sets the current test style.

parameter.name: TestStyle
parameter.help: Use 'default' to have the framework behave like cfcunit with respect to arguments; otherwise, pass 'cfunit' to behave like cfunit (i.e. for certain assertions, the message is the first arg). This only affects assertEquals and assertTrue

function.name: addAssertDecorators
function.help: Loads any assertions defined in mxunt-config.xml at runtime.

function.name: assertTrue
function.help: Core assertion that tests the CONDITION and throws mxunit.exception.AssertionFailedError on failure

parameter.name: condition
parameter.help: The condition to test. Note that expressions containing CFCs may likely fail

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Optional custom message to display if comparison fails.

function.name: fail
function.help: Fails a test with the given MESSAGE.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Custom message to print in the failure.

function.name: assertEquals
function.help: Core assertion that compares the values the EXPECTED and ACTUAL parameters. Throws mxunit.exception.AssertionFailedError.

parameter.name: expected
parameter.help: The expected object to compare.

parameter.name: actual
parameter.help: The actual object to compare.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Optional custom message to display if comparison fails.

function.name: getTestStyle
function.help: returns the current test style

function.name: HamcrestAssert
function.help: Constructor

function.name: mock
function.help: Creates a mock object of the optional type passed in.

function.name: injectMethod
function.help: injects the method from giver into receiver. This is helpful for quick and dirty mocking

parameter.name: Receiver
parameter.help: the object receiving the method

parameter.name: Giver
parameter.help: the object giving the method

parameter.name: functionName
parameter.help: the function to be injected from the giver into the receiver

parameter.name: functionNameInReceiver
parameter.help: the function name that you will call. this is useful when you want to inject giver.someFunctionXXX but have it be called as someFunction in your receiver object

function.name: debug
function.help: Use in your tests to add simple or complex debug data to test results. Used by Eclpise plugin heavily.

function.name: setUp
function.help: Override in your testcase

function.name: toStringValue
function.help: Returns the name of this TestCase

function.name: runBare
function.help: Not really used

function.name: accept
function.help: contains the logic for whether a test is a valid runnable method

parameter.name: TestStruct
parameter.help: Structure for a function coming from getmetadata

function.name: run
function.help: Main run method used by the Eclipse Plugin

function.name: tearDown
function.help: Override in your testcase

function.name: makePublic
function.help: makes a testable version of a private method for a given object. This is a convenience pass-through to PublicProxyMaker.makePublic. See documentation on 'testing private methods' at mxunit.org/doc. Or open mxunit/tests/framework/PublicProxyMakerTest.cfc f

parameter.name: ObjectUnderTest
parameter.help: an instance of the object with a private method to be proxied

parameter.name: privateMethodName
parameter.help: name of the private method to be proxied

parameter.name: proxyMethodName
parameter.help: name of the proxy method name to be used; if not passed, defaults to the name of the private method prefixed with an underscore

function.name: getDebug
function.help: Returns the debug array

function.name: clearDebug
function.help: Clears the debug array

function.name: runTestRemote
function.help: Remote method for running tests quickly via Http.

parameter.name: testMethod
parameter.help: A single test to run. If not specified, all tests are run.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Flag to indicate whether or not to dump the test results to the screen.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Output format: html,xml,junitxml,extjs

function.name: getRunnableMethods
function.help: Gets an array of all runnable test methods for this test case. This includes anything in its inheritance hierarchy

parameter.name: xpath
parameter.help: string representing an xpath expression

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: String or URL to search

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: The text to match against the xpath expression. If omitted, this assertion returns true if any elements of the xpath epxression are found.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: The mssage to display when this assertion fails

function.name: wrapScriptTagInCDATA
function.help: Regular Expression util wrapper. Wraps script tag in CDATA section for xml parsing.

parameter.name: html
parameter.help: Wraps the internal contents of script tags with a CDATA section. Workaround for JTidy lack.

parameter.name: html
parameter.help: Wraps the internal contents of script tags with a CDATA section. Workaround for JTidy lack.

function.name: buildXmlDom
function.help: Experimental!

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: A string that needs to be parsed into an XML DOM Object.

parameter.name: isUrl
parameter.help: Flag that determines whether or not the data argument is a URL as opposed to a string.
